description.short: The largest religious monument in the world.
description.long: Angkor Wat is a vast temple complex in Cambodia, originally built as a Hindu temple in the early 12th century. It later became a Buddhist temple and is now a UNESCO World Heritage site. The intricate carvings and massive size make it Cambodia’s most famous attraction.

description.short: A tropical island with pristine beaches.
description.long: Koh Rong is a Cambodian island in the Gulf of Thailand, known for its white-sand beaches, clear blue waters, and laid-back atmosphere. The island offers activities like snorkeling, diving, and hiking, making it a popular destination for nature lovers and beachgoers.

description.short: The residence of the King of Cambodia and a symbol of the monarchy.
description.long: The Royal Palace in Phnom Penh is a beautiful example of Cambodian architecture and serves as the residence of the King of Cambodia. Visitors can explore its opulent buildings, including the Silver Pagoda, which houses many national treasures.

image.alt: View of the Royal Palace in Phnom Penh

description.short: The largest freshwater lake in Southeast Asia.
description.long: Tonle Sap is a vast freshwater lake that plays a crucial role in Cambodia’s ecology and economy. It is home to floating villages and a variety of bird species, making it a popular destination for eco-tourism and a unique insight into the country’s rural life.

image.alt: Floating village on Tonle Sap Lake
image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.short: A sacred mountain with waterfalls and ancient ruins.
description.long: Phnom Kulen is one of Cambodia’s most important spiritual sites. The national park offers lush landscapes, waterfalls, and ancient relics, including the Thousand Lingas, a series of riverbed carvings, and a large reclining Buddha statue on top of the mountain.

image.alt: Waterfall in Phnom Kulen National Park

description.short: A remote archaeological site featuring a pyramid-like temple.
description.long: Koh Ker is an ancient Khmer city and archaeological site in northern Cambodia. The site is famous for its impressive seven-tiered pyramid, Prasat Thom, and the numerous temples scattered throughout the jungle, offering a glimpse into Cambodia’s distant past.
